content: HeroUI is a UI library for React built on top of Tailwind CSS and React Aria. Its primary goal is to streamline the development process by offering a beautiful, accessible, and adaptable system design.
No, HeroUI is not a copy-paste library. All components are available as packages via npm and can be installed individually or as a whole.

TailwindCSS is a CSS framework providing atomic classes. HeroUI is a complete UI library for React that uses Tailwind as its style engine but adds component logic, accessibility (via React Aria), and composition.

topic: Difference from other Tailwind component libraries
content: Libraries like TailwindUI or Flowbite offer styled HTML snippets. HeroUI provides complete React components with logic, props, accessibility features, and composition, not just CSS classes.

topic: How HeroUI handles TailwindCSS class conflicts
content: HeroUI uses a utility called `tailwind-variants` that automatically handles TailwindCSS class conflicts, ensuring custom classes consistently override default ones without duplication.
No. HeroUI uses TailwindCSS as its style engine, which generates all CSS at build time. This makes it fully compatible with the latest React and Next.js versions.
